Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Initial commit: PrintOrderWeb - Blockchain-enabled print job ordering system

PrintOrderWeb is a production-ready Flask web application that provides a
browser-based interface for submitting print jobs to a blockchain-based
consumable tracking system via the ConsumableClient API.

Key Features:
- Dead-simple 4-step workflow: Upload PDF â†’ Configure Details â†’ Review â†’ Submit
- Real-time blockchain inventory integration with 30-second auto-refresh
- Quality-aware consumable estimation (draft/standard/high quality modes)
- Live progress updates with AJAX polling (non-blocking UI)
- Thread-per-job architecture for concurrent job processing
- Dual-mode operation: stub mode for development, real blockchain for production
- Multi-language support (English/German) with i18n
- Authenticated UI with ink slot verification against blockchain data
- Comprehensive metadata extraction (17+ fields per consumable)
- PyInstaller packaging for standalone Windows executable

Architecture:
- Flask web framework with Jinja2 templates
- Thread-safe DLL wrapper for ConsumableClient API v2.0.0.2
- Background inventory refresh thread with cache management
- Independent job submission threads for non-blocking operation
- Three-tier error handling with graceful fallbacks

Tech Stack:
- Python 3.11+ / Flask 3.0
- ConsumableClient.dll (blockchain integration)
- Bootstrap CSS / Vanilla JavaScript
- PyInstaller for executable builds
